A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: A very good Rian Johnson movie but not the best Star Wars movie. Johnson succeeds on so many levels but there are areas that do not fit at all as a sequel to the Force Awakens. The Last Jedi tries a lot of new things\, some work but some completely mishandle story set up by JJ Abrams.\nIt fails to set things up for a grand finale\, instead ending on a mediocre note that doesn't leave much room for build-up. A couple of tweaks could have made this a great movie. It needed some discussion with Abrams to better connect the stories. In the end\, you're left with a pretty average Star Wars tale.
